title: I think CDR is too available.
body: I remember back in the day when Riven had to take CDR runes to get max cdr and fizz took cdr runes, now every item and its uncle has cdr on it.

replies.body: it not that easy to get max xrd with just dmg items though
It's harder to _not _ have more than 40% now.

> [{quoted}](name=Enloct,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=eQaTQfL7,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-11-13T07:50:09.547+0000)
>
> It's harder to _not _ have more than 40% now.

Lol yah, aha ill be playing a mage and be like, no I cant build zhonyas I already have 45% cdr
{{item:3165}} {{item:3157}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3100}}  used to only be 20% total cdr back in the good ol' days.
now its 50%
and then you realize that AP actually got the short end when it comes to cdr XD

????
How when nearly every AP item got CDR on it? 
Abyssal didn't have that, zhonyas didn't have that. 
LichBane i am not too sure about.

The reason that's bad is Riot now _expects_ mages to be spamming spells, so we're no longer allowed to just build a ton of AP for massive burst with a long cooldown.

Of course, there are a couple champions who get both...
lichbane has 10% now and used to have 0%. what i meant is that compared to AD items AP has less. AD items have a bout 120% total cdr. AP items have 80-90% total.

> [{quoted}](name=MatthewRT2,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=eQaTQfL7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-13T06:28:55.166+0000)
>
> it not that easy to get max xrd with just dmg items though

{{item:3071}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3508}} {{item:1400}} {{item:3078}}

Is there any champion that builds any 6 of those? I'm asking, not arguing. 

EDIT: Why was I downvoted :(
{{champion:15}} {{champion:236}}  just need {{item:3158}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3046}} to get 40% cdr.
Oh, I didn't know they build lucidity boots
They usually don't, {{item:3006}} are better.
Depends. With 45% CDR, an AD caster gets a lot more dmg from CDR than AS since he mostly relies on his passive for the output damage.
Nobody goes that far into the cunning tree anymore.
Depends on the player.

As a Vi main, i build warrior and either tri or BC every game, and Maw is my most common offensive MR item, with ghostblade being a common aggro item on Vi as well. A lot of bruisers build similarly as well.
I see, thanks

Well bruisers would love the black cleaver and maw, that's 30% already, they'll probably have the last 10% from a tank item like spirit or warmogs, or go overkill on cd with iceborn

Assassins would build yomuus maw and black cleaver so 40% done right there
True, and some bruisers would go Triforce as well
Ghostblade is only for assassins now. It got a huge nerf to anyone else and its damage tanked.

{{item:3071}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3158}} Build either one for ad or ap and then these boots. You have 30% so you take 5% in intelligence, FLAT 5% cdr blues and 3 scaling cdr blues. That is your 45% with 1 item and boots.

{{item:3071}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3142}} {{item:1412}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3025}}  or {{item:3157}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3060}} {{item:3152}} for sure tho that struggle is just too real man kek
This was Riot's intention, they even shaped the mage meta around cdr by giving cd nerfs. Classic examples: {{champion:8}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:105}}

I still take CDR blues on my assassins. Specifically the scaling ones and only enough for 10%. It helps me free up an item slot for some other utility and/or raw damage and lets me not get CDR boots. I hate CDR boots on assassins
What boots do you get on assassins? Certainly not zerkers. (Though if you mean ap assassins, then it's obvious.)

Swifties mainly. Assassins are all about positioning and getting to a target so that's what its for. Maybe mobis if I'm in the mood and feel like I need to pressure the map more. And then of course mercs if they have a ton of cc
Because items like {{item:3071}} exists. Best of every fucking worlds. Built on every single AD champion in the game with absolutely no counterplay and no cons.

every class has a core item

cleaver just happens to have replaced hydra as the core fighter/bruiser  item
its hard for shen to get cdr ;-;
Well, move some CDR back to my support tank items, my leona wants more CDR avaliable

Wait, what? Tank supports already have enough CDR
Zeke
Frozen Heart
Spirit Visage
Banner
Redemption
Mikael
All T3 sightstones
No tank support ever builds spirit visage or zeke's herald.
I just think we need to remove 20% cdr items.

Riot's ideology was decrease damage>decrease CD.
That means in theory you should not get one shot by a lux, but she will be able to cast more spells on you allowing for a shorter burst time.
instead of  Q E R it's 
Q E, wait Q E R 
(in theory)
Which is something that actually makes sense. It gives you more time to back off and respond.
yea as riven I build {{item:3071}}  {{item:3142}} already have 45% cdr pretty nice
Well she needs {{item:3158}}  also

> [{quoted}](name=GrReaper96,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=eQaTQfL7,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2016-11-13T17:52:16.770+0000)
>
> Well she needs {{item:3158}}  also

nope I have 45% cdr with those 2 items I build {{item:3111}} or  {{item:3047}}  depending on game
Then you have cdr runes.
masteries actually + 5%
tear users who don't like zhonya's or morello feelsbad
But morello works so well with tear. Who doesn't like that combo?
Anivia mostly, she already gets GLP/RoA so Morello just adds an unnecessary amount of mana.
I wouldn't mind it so much if they used smaller numbers. Instead of 5-20 let's try 2.5-10.
eh. I just buy all the cdr I want and don't worry about wasting a bit in stats if I get good passives.

THIS!!! Was about to make a post like this. Almost every item had CDR. Back then, 40% CDR was something few people aimed for because their core items didn't possess it. Now almost every item has CDR. Mid lane? 40% CDR at 20 mins. Supp, Same. Top, Same. Jungle, Same. ADC gets it with 2 items. It's so fcking annoying.
Yeah it's pretty annoying that when you try certain item builds they aren't as efficient because you end up with 50-60 cdr

CDR is the crit of mages (kinda). I think that most builds should naturally learn towards 30-40%.  Some classes definitely have more access than others.

For examples, enchanters have so much CDR that they actually need to be extremely careful not to go over.
